about_the_game:
“Godforsaken. No other word for it. A murder so brutal it made the whole town of Asbury Pines look itself in the mirror. We work, we raise kids, we do our best, we let time run its course, and then we’re still left scratchin’ our heads. Why did this evil have to happen?”

- Rodney “Buzz” Snow, Sheriff of Asbury Pines

Asbury Pines is a narrative twist in the incremental genre. Combine and synthesize the work of Abury Pines townfolk (the Pinies) to unveil a murder mystery across the small town’s history – from the late stone age to the deep future. Immersive writing and image-rich worldbuilding pair with idle/incremental gameplay. As you unlock an array of characters, artifacts and places from one era to the next, combine them and their unique stats in different ways to build and link resource production economies… across centuries. What emerges is a sprawling factory of working lives that unveils a story embedded in the flow of time.

If you enjoy gameplay that balances resource management, rich narrative development, automation/factory strategy, and idle progression, try the demo!



From Hrokk the caveman to Moharan the temporal physicist, strategize and connect the work of Pinies through the dozen eras of Asbury Pines history. As you create and modify your resource production engine, you unlock more people, places, and upgrades that combine to strengthen yields and unveil greater depths of a grand mystery.



The breadth and possibility of your plans grow alongside the story.



There ain’t any angels among the Pinies, but a good many are hearty folk who aspire to make a proud home. How did this bizarre murder happen, and why? The narrative begins in the present day and spreads – past and future – across 12 eras from the late stone age to the deep hereafter. Each era brings more details, characters, intrigue, and answers to a mystery that spans the flow of time.



Explore how individual insights, conversations, and documents – stories from wildlife, artifacts, inhabitants, heroes, and invaders – piece together and connect one era to the next, one answer to another.



More than 50 people, plants, and animals with unique stats and backgrounds emerge across the history of Asbury Pines. They drive the mystery with their personal stories, age across timelines, and contribute to the resource growth needed to progress.




Features

  • Expansive worldbuilding based on an image-rich narrative.
  • Accessible and evolving progression systems that build on unlocked content, characters, and places.
  • Nearly 400 hours of balanced resource management, story development, and progression gameplay.
  • More than 50 characters with 350+ stories to discover and utilize.
  • Offline progression.
  • No microtransactions for consistent player experience.

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS *: Windows 7 (SP1+) or Higher
  • Processor: ~2.0 GHz+
  • Memory: 1 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Intel Integrated Graphics
  • DirectX: Version 11
  • Storage: 500 MB available space
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • OS *: Windows 7 (SP1+) or Higher
  • Processor: ~3.0 GHz+
  • Memory: 2 GB RAM
  • Graphics: DX12 and (shader model 4.0) capabilities, e.g. Nvidia GeForce GTX
  • DirectX: Version 12
  • Storage: 1 GB available space
  • Additional Notes: Video Resolution: 1080p is Highly Recommended

short_description: A grisly murder in a small town unfolds across past and future. Orchestrate and connect the lives of Asbury Pines residents. Grow resources and build rewarding production engines that link across eras. All to unlock a sprawling mystery embedded in the flow of time.
